STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 23, 2020
Carey Adrianse
Wexford/Missaukee County DHHS
10641 W Watergate
Cadillac, MI 49601
RE: License #: CP830201508
Wexford/Missaukee County DHHS
10641 W Watergate
Cadillac, MI 49601-0309
Dear Ms. Adrianse:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on October 26,
2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Modified Implementation, Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP), a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Claudia Triestram at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 200
121 Franklin Street SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Three foster care files were review, and three independent living files were reviewed.
One of fifteen updated service plans reviewed was completed after the required 90-
day timeframe.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MSA requirements except for the
following:
MISEP 6.49 Medical Passports
At the time the child is placed or re-placed, the foster care
provider shall receive the child’s Medical Passport, which must
contain the information required by MCL 722.954c(2) and DHHS
Policy FOM 801 (dated 3-1-2015) (or any successor policies
approved by the Monitors). And at least quarterly thereafter, an
updated Medical Passport must be prepared, as required by the
“Medical Passports” section of DHHS Policy FOM 801 (dated 3-
1-2015) (or any successor policy approved by the Monitors),
and provided to the foster care provider.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One of three files lacked the updated quarterly
medical passport as required. This is a repeat violation from the interim
inspection dated 9/30/2019.
MISEP 6.33 Assessments and Service Plans, Content
(c) Service plans shall be signed by the caseworker, the
caseworker’s supervisor, the parent(s), and the child(ren), if of
age to participate. If the parent(s) or child(ren) or both are not
available or decline to sign the plan, the service plan shall
include an explanation of the steps taken to involve them and
4

shall identify any follow-up actions to be taken to secure their
participation in services.
Three foster care files were reviewed, and three independent living files were
reviewed. Eighteen case service plans were reviewed. Six of twelve service plans
that required youth signatures did not have the signature as required. One of ten
service plans that required parent signature did not have the signature as required.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-06H Timely Entry of Caseworker Contacts
The caseworker must enter the required face-to-face contacts
listed below in MISACWIS within five business days of the contact.
This includes attempted and missed face-to-face contacts.
Any face-to-face contact with children, parents, or caregivers
made by any of the following:
• Foster care caseworker/supervisor.
• CPS caseworker/supervisor.
• Adoption caseworker/supervisor.
• Permanency resource monitors.
• Education planners.
• Michigan Youth Opportunities Initiative coordinators.
• Parent/child face-to-face contacts.
• Sibling face-to-face contacts.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Three of three files contained face to face
contacts that were not entered into MiSACWIS within the five days as required. This
is a repeat violation from the interim inspection dated 9/30/2019.
FOM 722-03E Placement Exception Requests and Approvals
Placement of a child or dual ward into a CCI must be approved
every 90 days prior to the following PER type time frames:
• Initial placement in a residential facility.
• Three months from the date of initial placement.
• Six months from the date of initial placement.
• Nine months from the date of initial placement.
5

Three foster care files were reviewed. One of three foster care files reviewed
required PER for residential placement. One of one PER required was completed
after the required timeframe.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance during this period under review.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request or require consultation in this period under review.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. Wexford Missaukee DHHS is in
compliance with their approved CAP except MISEP 6.49 Medical Passports and
FOM 722-06H Timely entry of caseworker contacts, which was cited above.
There were no complaints filed during the licensing period which would require a
special investigation.
There were no safety alerts generated during the licensing period.
6

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
_____________________________________November 20, 2020
Stephanie Meeuwenberg Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 23, 2020
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
